newsitem.title: BELARUS: Belarus to raise sugar import duty to 20 pct.
newsitem.headline: Belarus to raise sugar import duty to 20 pct.

text.p: Belarus will double its refined sugar import duty to 20 percent from 10 percent as part of a new import tariff schedule effective March 19, the prime minister's press secretary said on Wednesday.

"As of March 19, Belarus is implementing a new tariff schedule just like, or similar to, the one in Russia," Dmitry Malinovsky told Reuters. "Raw sugar import duties will remain at one percent," he said.
The former Soviet republic of Belarus has been importing small amounts of refined sugar to supplement the 132,500 tonnes produced from its 1996 beet crop.
It recently imported 260,000 tonnes of raws from Brazil to meet domestic needs for refined sugar.
Belarus's 1996 sugar beet harvest was one million tonnes, below 1995's 1.14 million tonnes.
